name: Chicken and Cheese Stuffed Jumbo Shells
author: ECHO2003
summary: I came up with this based upon another recipe, but used things I had in the kitchen. It is a great alternative if your family or guests don't eat red meat!
ingredients: 4  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
Separate shells and let stand, so they are not touching, on waxed paper or foil
In large skillet over medium heat, combine chicken, onion, egg and bread crumbs
Cook until chicken is no longer pink
Season with oregano, basil, salt and pepper
Stir in three-quarters of the shredded mozzarella and cheddar; cook until cheeses melt
Fill shells with chicken mixture, using a tablespoon, and place in a 9 x 13 baking dish
Cover the shells with the  tomato sauce and top with the reserved cheese
Cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, or until lightly browned and bubbly
